name: Hotel Restaurant L'Arena

reviews.title: Charming little hotel
reviews.text: We had dinner here. The surroundings were lovely and the food very good; sophisticated Mediterranean. The hotel looked absolutely delightful. There were some families there as well as older couples.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here two nights -- to be on the Riviera but not in the more expensive places like Cannes and St. Tropez. The hotel is very central, charming, clean, with huge rooms and a very comfortable king-size bed. Breakfast was fine. We ate in the hotel one night, as we had arrived late -- very sophisticated food, a tad expensive. Staff was helpful in showing us how to park our car in city lot at minimal expense. Driving the Cornice L'Esterel is highly recommended: spectacular ocean/cliff views, with fewer tourists than above Nice. Two minor complaints about hotel: our windows wouldn't open (noice-reducing inner windows -- they did work on the noise) and no free internet access.
reviews.title: Great location and feeling
Sun, sea, sand and history
reviews.text: My wife and I plus our 3 years old daughter recently spent a week in this hotel. Lovely old property with a small pool and lots of greenery and flowers. We booked a triple room overlooking the pool and garden with views across Frejus to the mountains. To be honest we may as well have had a double room without the view and saved 40 euros per night as we were out most of the day and the room simply served as a place to wash and sleep. We skipped breakfast at 10 euros each and used the local boulangerie and cafe bars instead. The restaurant in the hotel is very expensive but apparently very good (beyond our budget I'm afraid).

reviews.title: Very Good
reviews.text: This was only our second trip to France so I cannot comment on many other towns there but I cannot understand the negative comments regarding Frejus. It has a lovely beach (a fair walk), a marina complex (on the way to the beach) with bars and restaurants. A beautiful town square with a 13th century chapel and baptistry with small museum. A Roman amphitheatre. Twice weekly food markets with superb produce. Several quality restaurants with good value menus. Several bars and some of the finest bread and pastry shops I have encountered. After 3 or 4 days of this maybe you get itchy feet. No problem catch the TGV 5 minutes from the hotel to Nice, Cannes, Monaco, Marseille, Avignon or even Paris. You want to go to St Tropez catch the bus 10 minutes from the hotel. You want to do some serious walking then head for the Esterel flanking the whole coastline. If you cannot find enough to do here you are not trying hard enough. We will be back in 2005.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel
reviews.text: At 95 euro per night, this was the best value of the nine hotels we stayed in during our recent trip through France and Italy. The place is nice: newer rooms, great staff, cute little pool area.

We stayed in Frejus to break up a drive... it served its purpose, and we walked around a bit before eating dinner outside. While it was a perfectly pleasant place, I can't imagine that anyone would want to visit the town when there are so many more interesting areas in southern France.
reviews.title: A quaint and sophistocated little hotel

description: CHARM AND SERENITY...Composed of three typical Provence buildings, the Arena Hotel and Restaurant offers 39 richly colored bright rooms, mostly looking over the swimming pool and the exotic garden. The hotel, member of Exclusive Hotels, is situated in the heart of old Frejus & is the ideal starting point to discover the local activities.THE AROMAS OF THE MEDITERRANEAN...Appreciate the delights of the luxuriant garden surrounded by laurel and palm trees, among cascades of geraniums.
